00001 /* 
00002  * jcom.mkdir
00003  * External for Jamoma: create a directory on the filesystem
00004  * Original By Bill Orcutt
00005  * Re-write for Max5 by Tim Place, 2007
00006  * 
00007  * License: This code is licensed under the terms of the GNU LGPL
00008  * http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html 
00009  */
00010 
00011 #include "Jamoma.h"
00012 
00013 
00014 typedef struct _mkdir{
00015         t_object        obj;
00016         void            *obex;
00017 } t_mkdir;
00018 
00019 
00020 void *mkdir_new(void);
00021 void mkdir_free(t_mkdir *x);
00022 void mkdir_assist(t_mkdir *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);
00023 void mkdir_make(t_mkdir *x, t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00024 void mkdir_domake(t_mkdir *x, t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00025 
00026 
00027 static t_class *mkdir_class;
00028 
00029 
00030 /************************************************************************************/
00031 int main(void)
00032 {
00033         t_class *c;
00034         
00035         jamoma_init();
00036         
00037         // Define our class
00038         c = class_new("jcom.mkdir",(method)mkdir_new, (method)mkdir_free, (short)sizeof(t_mkdir), (method)0L, 0L, 0);
00039         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_mkdir, obex));
00040 
00041         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00042         class_addmethod(c, (method)mkdir_make,                  "anything", A_GIMME, 0L);
00043     class_addmethod(c, (method)mkdir_assist,            "assist",       A_CANT, 0L); 
00044 
00045         // Finalize our class
00046         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00047         mkdir_class = c;
00048         return 0;
00049 }
00050 
00051 
00052 /************************************************************************************/
00053 void *mkdir_new(void)
00054 {       
00055         t_mkdir *x;
00056         
00057         x = (t_mkdir *)object_alloc(mkdir_class);       // Create object, store pointer to it (get 1 inlet free)
00058 
00059         if(x){
00060                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x,NULL));       // dumpout      
00061         }
00062         return (x);
00063 }
00064 
00065 
00066 void mkdir_free(t_mkdir *x)
00067 {
00068         ;
00069 }                       
00070 
00071 
00072 /************************************************************************************/
00073 void mkdir_assist(t_mkdir *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00074 {
00075         if(msg == 1){
00076                 switch (arg){
00077                         case 0:
00078                                 strcpy(dst, "path to folder to be created.");
00079                                 break;
00080                 }
00081         }
00082 }       
00083 
00084 
00085 void mkdir_make(t_mkdir *x, t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00086 {
00087         defer_low(x, (method)mkdir_domake, s, 0, 0);
00088 }
00089 
00090 
00091 void mkdir_domake(t_mkdir *x, t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00092 {
00093         short   path = 0;                               // parent folder, which we supply
00094         short   createdPath = 0;                // the new folder after it is created
00095         char    *folderName;                    // the name of the new folder
00096         char    fullpath[4096];
00097         short   err = 0;
00098         char    temp[256];
00099         
00100         path_nameconform(s->s_name, fullpath, PATH_STYLE_MAX, PATH_TYPE_ABSOLUTE);
00101         folderName = strrchr(fullpath, '/');
00102         
00103         if(folderName){
00104                 *folderName = 0;
00105                 folderName++;
00106                 
00107                 err = path_frompathname(fullpath, &path, temp);
00108                 if(!err)
00109                         err = path_createfolder(path, folderName, &createdPath);
00110                 if(err)
00111                         error("mkdir: error %hd trying to create folder", err);
00112         }
00113 }
